thesis.description: It was shown experimentally by Parrot (1815) that when a partition between two gases is removed, the two gases would intermingle even in the absence of mechanical agitation and convection currents. The process which causes this tendency towards homogeniety is called diffusion. One of the earliest direct observations that metals would inter-diffuse was the qualitative investigation of Spring in 1894. [...]
thesis.creator: MacEwan, John Ross.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: a Study of the Rate of Self-Diffusion of Nickel and of the Rate of Diffusion of Nickel into Iron, Cobalt and Two Iron-Nickel Alloys.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
